clues.text: The children of an elementary school in Fresno led the way in getting the dogface butterfly official designation in this state
McGill University, founded 1821, is sometimes called this, after a university founded in 1636
Fela Kuti has a song named for one of these creatures, the revived undead
Last names of Nick & Vanessa, who began hosting Netflix' "Love is Blind" in 2020
This 3-letter word can refer to a state of intoxication, making a person incandescent

(Jenna Bush Hager presents the clue.) I developed my love of books as a child; my parents always made sure we were surrounded by plenty, & a favorite they used to read to me aloud wasthisauthor's "James and the Giant Peach"
Both found on its long migration routes--Texas & Minnesota each pickedthisregal flyer
The Gemini Awards, last given in 2011 for excellence in television: these, after awards first given in 1949

Scheming dispatcher Louie de Palma kept his charges in line in this 1970s classic
Could you be any more this 5-letter word that means mainstream, like pumpkin spice lattes

(Jenna Bush Hager presents the clue.) One of my club picks for 2023 is "Black Candle Women" byDiane Marie Brown, about four generations of women who live under one roof & have a big secret--a love curse relating to a Voodoo sorceress inthisSouthern city that links the story back to the 1950s
This bioluminescent pick for Pennsylvania lights up summer evenings
Montreal, with a Rue Saint-Jacques & a French heritage: this, after a city with a Rue Saint-Jacques & even Frencher heritage

It's not just for brides! A man getting married can turn into this portmanteau monster

(Jenna Bush Hager presents the clue.) The perfect vacation read & one my sister Barbara & I still talk about is "Summer Sisters", a novel for adults bythiswoman who is beloved for her young adult fiction
This industrious insect important to agriculture was chosen by Nebraska & Missouri

Reports of his "fiddling" while Rome burned are greatly exaggerated; fiddles didn't even exist back then
Its islands include Syros, Sifnos, Skiathos & Serifos
A drink of whiskey & soda gave its name to this type of glass seenhere
As seen in thebust, Commodus was obsessed with this he-man of Greek myth, even dressing as him
Dumbo, which, as you can see, is short for Down Under the Manhattan Bridge Overpass is a neighborhood in this borough
Floods is another way to say this slang term for pants that are too short
Kevin James played Doug Heffernan on "Everybody Loves Raymond" after Doug borough-ed into his own sitcom titled this
This Bible book gives us the line "Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil"
Paddle 1,200 miles of routes named for this type of boat in Minnesota's Boundary Waters Wilderness
Hadrian had his wall & this cousin who immediately preceded him had his column
The sea of this, a name big in the Bible, is really a freshwater lake that gets most of its inflow from the Jordan River
Sean Connery teaches a Scot to fight & be immortal in this film
2023 brought this NBA superstar & self-described lifelong nomad to his fourth team, the Phoenix Suns
The title character of this play says, "Life's but a walking shadow, a poor player"
You can take a nice-sized ride of 700 miles on a single tank of gas in a Sonata hybrid blue by this car company
Incitatus was this emperor's favorite horse & legend says he once tried to make the animal a consul

In 1961 he became the first American to ride into space; apparently enjoying the area, he took a walk on the Moon 10 years later
Seenhereis the exterior of the once-magnificent baths of this emperor, which could accommodate some 1,600 bathers
In 1994 this South African province was divided up into 4 smaller ones that include what's now called Limpopo
This fashionable London district is home to the cemetery where Douglas Adams & Karl Marx reside
Kevin McDonald was Sir Simon Milligan & Dave Foley, his manservant Hecubus on this "youthful" Canadian sketch show
